info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 31 at 2:49PM PDT until August 01 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ..Isolated to Scattered Thunderstorms with Abundant Lightning on Dry Fuels Expected this Afternoon and Evening... .Hot and unstable conditions are expected today as high pressure remains over the region. Low pressure offshore will bring increasing mid level moisture and southerly flow aloft. This will lead to increased potential for isolated to scattered thunderstorms mainly across the central Oregon Cascades. Any storms that do develop will be capable of producing abundant lightning and strong, gusty outflow winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 608... * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 608 Willamette National Forest. * THUNDERSTORMS...3 (A chance of thunderstorms). * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic outflow winds of 30 to 50 mph may occur with thunderstorms. * IMPACTS...Frequent lightning and critically dry fuels may result in numerous fire starts. Thunderstorm outflow winds may result in erratic fire spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
